member.name: T:System.Waf.WafConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration settings for the WPF Application Framework (WAF).

member.name: P:System.Waf.WafConfiguration.IsInDesignMode
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the code is running in design mode.
member.value: true if the code is running in design mode; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Waf.WafConfiguration.Debug
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether WAF should run in Debug mode.
member.remarks: The Debug mode helps to find errors in the application but it might reduce the performance.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Applications.SynchronizingCollection`2
member.summary: Represents a collection that synchronizes all of it's items with the items of the specified original collection. When the original collection notifies a change via the interface then this collection synchronizes it's own items with the original items.
member.typeparam: The type of elements in the collection.
The type of elements in the original collection.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The factory which is used to create new elements in this collection.
member.exception: The argument originalCollection must not be null.
The argument factory must not be null.

member.summary: Occurs when the collection changes.

member.name: E:System.Waf.Applications.SynchronizingCollection`2.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Occurs when a property value changes.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList
member.summary: This class encapsulates the logic for a recent file list.
member.remarks: This class can be used in a Settings file to store and load the recent file list as user settings. In Visual Studio you might need to enter the full class name "System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList" in the "Select a type" dialog.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.Load(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile})
member.summary: Loads the specified collection into the recent file list. Use this method when you need to initialize the RecentFileList manually. This can be useful when you are using an own persistence implementation.
member.remarks: Recent file items that exist before the Load method is called are removed.
member.exception: The argument recentFiles must not be null.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.AddFile(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a file to the recent file list. If the file already exists in the list then it only changes the position in the list.
member.param: The path of the recent file.
member.exception: The argument fileName must not be null or empty.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.Remove(System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile)
member.summary: Removes the specified recent file.
member.exception: The argument recentFile must not be null.
The argument recentFile was not found in the recent files list.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.RecentFiles
member.summary: Gets the list of recent files.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.MaxFilesNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of recent files in the list.
member.remarks: If the set number is lower than the list count then the recent file list is truncated to the number.
member.exception: The value must be equal or larger than 1.

member.param: The window that owns this Message Window.

member.summary: Shows the message as error.
member.param: The window that owns this Message Window.

member.returns: true for yes, false for no and null for cancel.

member.summary: Shows the specified yes/no question.

member.summary: Converts a collection of objects into a multi-line string of error messages.

The converter parameter to use. This parameter will be ignored.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A multi-line error message or an empty string when the collection contains no errors. If the value parameter is null or not of the type IEnumerable<ValidationError> this method returns .

member.summary: This method is not supported and throws an exception when it is called.

The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: Nothing because this method throws an exception.
member.exception: Throws this exception when the method is called.

member.summary: Gets the ViewModel which is associated with the specified view.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Presentation.ValidationHelper
member.summary: Provides methods and attached properties that support data validation tracking. This works only if NotifyOnValidationError=true is set by every Binding that participates in data validation.

member.name: F:System.Waf.Presentation.ValidationHelper.IsEnabledProperty
member.summary: Identifies the IsEnabled attached property. This property contains the value that indicates whether the ValidationHelper is enabled.

member.name: F:System.Waf.Presentation.ValidationHelper.IsValidProperty
member.summary: Identifies the IsValid attached property. This property contains the value that indicates whether the associated object is valid.
member.remarks: This is a readonly property. However, it is allowed to define a Binding with the Mode=OneWayToSource for this property.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Presentation.ValidationHelper.GetIsEnabled(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the ValidationHelper is enabled.
member.param: The object to read the value from.
member.returns: true, if the ValidationHelper is enabled.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Presentation.ValidationHelper.SetIsEnabled(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value that indicates whether the ValidationHelper is enabled. The default value is 'false'. It is not allowed to call this method with 'false'.
member.param: The object to set the value to.
if set to true then the ValidationHelper is enabled for the specified object.
member.exception: The value must not be set to 'false'.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Presentation.ValidationHelper.GetIsValid(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the object is valid.
member.param: The object to read the value from.
member.returns: true, if the object is valid.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Presentation.ValidationHelper.SetIsValid(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Do not call this method. It is for internal use only.
member.param: The object to set the value to.
if set to true then the object is valid.
member.exception: Thrown when this method is called.

member.summary: Appends the specified string in a new line or the first line when the was empty.
member.returns: A reference to this instance after the append operation has completed.
member.exception: The argument stringBuilder must not be null.
Enlarging the value of this instance would exceed System.Text.StringBuilder.MaxCapacity.

member.summary: Obsolete: Represents a collection that converts all elements of an original collection into converted elements. When the original collection notifies a change via the interface then this collection synchronizes it's converted elements with the original one.
